name: Vegan Lofthouse Cookies
description: You know those soft sugar cookies at the grocery store with frosting and sprinkles? These are homemade vegan lofthouse cookies, and they are just as delicious (if not more so) as the store bought version! Made with my all time favorite vegan butter, Miyoko's, for a truly buttery flavor.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup Miyoko's European Style Vegan Butter, softened to room temperature (salted or unsalted, see Note)
1/2 cup vegan sour cream (or vegan yogurt)
1/2 teaspoon salt (or 3/4 tsp if using unsalted butter)
1/2 cup Miyoko's European Style Vegan Butter, softened to room temperature (add 1/4 tsp salt if using unsalted butter)
1-2 tablespoons non-dairy milk, as needed (I used oat milk)

itemListElement.text: In  a large bowl, cream together the softened vegan butter and sugar with a hand mixer (or stand mixer with paddle attachment) until fluffy. Beat in the vegan sour cream, vanilla and almond extract, if using. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.
itemListElement.name: In  a large bowl, cream together the softened vegan butter and sugar with a hand mixer (or stand mixer with paddle attachment) until fluffy. Beat in the vegan sour cream, vanilla and almond extract, if using. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.

itemListElement.text: To the bowl with the butter mixture, add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cornstarch and salt. Mix on low until just combined.
itemListElement.name: To the bowl with the butter mixture, add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cornstarch and salt. Mix on low until just combined.

itemListElement.text: Shape the dough into a disk, wrap in plastic and place in the refrigerator to chill for about an hour.
itemListElement.name: Shape the dough into a disk, wrap in plastic and place in the refrigerator to chill for about an hour.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.

itemListElement.text: Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface, using a rolling pin, about 1/4 inch thick.
itemListElement.name: Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface, using a rolling pin, about 1/4 inch thick.

itemListElement.text: Use a 2-3 inch round cookie cutter to cut the cookies and place on parchment or silicone lined baking sheets. Bake for 9-10 minutes until the cookies are very lightly golden on the bottom. Do not over bake or the cookies won't be soft.
itemListElement.name: Use a 2-3 inch round cookie cutter to cut the cookies and place on parchment or silicone lined baking sheets. Bake for 9-10 minutes until the cookies are very lightly golden on the bottom. Do not over bake or the cookies won't be soft.

itemListElement.text: Let the cookies cool on the pan for 5 minutes, then carefully transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely before frosting.
itemListElement.name: Let the cookies cool on the pan for 5 minutes, then carefully transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely before frosting.

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl (I use the same one I used for the dough, just wiped out or washed quickly), beat the vegan butter with a mixer until creamy, then add the powdered sugar, vanilla and non-dairy milk as needed if the frosting is too dry.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl (I use the same one I used for the dough, just wiped out or washed quickly), beat the vegan butter with a mixer until creamy, then add the powdered sugar, vanilla and non-dairy milk as needed if the frosting is too dry.

itemListElement.text: If using food coloring, mix it in now a drop at a time, until a desired colored is reached.
itemListElement.name: If using food coloring, mix it in now a drop at a time, until a desired colored is reached.

itemListElement.text: Frost the cookies with a layer of frosting and decorate with sprinkles.
